content: simple snowflake crochet pattern by ashley maglich/your craft gremlin this pattern is for your personal use do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please feel free to tag me @ashleymaglich or link to the pattern in any posts or mentions of thank you so much for your support i look forward to seeing what you create ©ashleymaglich abbreviations us terms ● mc - magic_ring ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● fo - fasten_off ● slip_stitch - slip stich materials yarn crochet hook *in tutorial i used 2mm* scissors needle - to sew in ends *i am using 2mm in the tutorial pattern for visual purposes however if you want it to be a lace crochet you will need to use crochet thread or embroidery thread with a much smaller hook size typically size 0 75mm 0 90mm up to a 1mm or 1 50mm ©ashleymaglich *for the snowflake in the photo i used a size 0 75mm hook* round 1 mc ch6 single_crochet into the ring x6 ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich pull center closed slip_stitch around the 1st ch6 round 2 *you are working around the ch6 not the stitches ch3 2dc ch2 3dc ©ashleymaglich *you re making granny cluster corners in every ch6 space slip_stitch into the top of the ch3 ©ashleymaglich round 3 slip_stitch in the next 3 stitches *you will now be in the corner ch3 *counts as double_crochet double_crochet ch3 2dc ch3 2dc ch3 2dc ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich *repeat in each corner space 2dc ch3 x3 2dc slip_stitch into ch3 round 4 ch1 4sc in ch3 space in nxt ch3 space double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch3 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet 4sc in the nxt ch3 space single_crochet in space between 2dc clusters ©ashleymaglich *repeat all the way around* slip_stitch into the first single_crochet from beginning ch1 & fo ©ashleymaglich *there are several different ways you can make a hanger for your snowflake if you decide to use it as an ornament you can chain whatever length you want your hanger & slip_stitch back into the first chain get a new piece of yarn and make a hanger from a different point of your snowflake or use an actual ornament hanger ©ashleymaglich you can now sew in your loose ends your snowflake is now complete i hope you enjoyed this project i would love to hear how your project turned out you can find me over on youtube at ashley maglich happy crocheting ©ashleymaglich
